docs.title: GoodCloud API
docs.text:
The Platform API is a RESTful interface that provides programmatic access to much of the data and actions in the system.

To ensure the security of user data, users must create a token on the platform and manually submit it to the third-party integration system.

To ensure the quality of interface data transmission and to provide clearer access to interface call records, we strongly recommend that users generate a token for each integration system they need to avoid token reuse.

docs.title: API Documentation
docs.text:
The RESTful API uses the following HTTP methods: GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, and DELETE.

Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: API Limit
docs.text: The rate limit is associated with the Access Token and restricts all requests made with this token to a maximum of 120 requests per minute.

docs.title: Available API Resources
docs.text:
The API follows simple REST principles and returns responses in JSON format. The API offers several endpoints, each with a unique path.

Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: Error Codes Description
docs.text: Error Code Description 0 success. Indicates that the server successfully handled the client's request and returned the requested resource. 10000001 Server error 10000002 Invalid token 10000003 Permission error! 10000015 Too many requests. Try again later 10002001 The department name already exists. 10002004 Modified data does not exist, please check! 10002011 Illegal organization name. 10009003 Param error 10009004 The organization name already exists. 10009005 This email has already become the owner of another organization. 10009006 The organization does not exist. 10009007 Illegal Organization Id 10009008 The device being added does not exist. 10009009 Illegal mailbox. 10009010 Device not Belong to the org. 10009011 The email list has become the owner of other organizations. 10009012 The device has already been Added by others. 10009014 Illegal MAC address.

docs.title: Webhooks Push-Styled API
docs.text:
The webhook push functionality is used to notify when the status of a device changes (e.g., device on/offline). The platform implements this using WebSocket.

If you need to use the Get organization devices interface, we strongly recommend following these steps to verify that device status changes are successfully pushed:

  1. Create an API Token: Follow the documentation in Create an Access Token to create the corresponding API token.

  2. Verify Device Connectivity: Ensure that there are devices in the organization where the API token was created and that these devices are properly connected to the platform (i.e., they are online).

  3. Connect to WebSocket: Use a WebSocket testing tool (e.g., Apifox) to establish the WebSocket connection.

  4. Create a New WebSocket API: In your testing tool, create or enter a project, hover over the Add button, and choose New WebSocket API to start the test.

  5. Enter WebSocket Address: In the address bar, enter the WebSocket URL, for example, wss://test.com/ws/websocket/zxcvbnmadsaaaaaaaaaafasdf. Note that this address is for illustration purposes only.

    The format of the WebSocket URL is: wss://+Domain name (The Target URL in the Access Token list)+/ws/websocket/+token value.

  6. Establish Connection: Click the Connect button. When the connection confirmation message appears, the connection is successfully established.

  7. Monitor Device Status Changes: Change the status of an online device (e.g., reboot, power down). WebSocket messages will synchronize and update. For example, if you perform a reboot operation, you will receive a message as shown below, indicating that device status updates are being received:

docs.title: Personal Access Tokens
docs.text:
To ensure the security of data transmission and processing using HTTPS communication, all requests must use a Bearer Token for authentication.

Users need to securely store the token and include the access token in the request header with every request.

docs.title: Access to Token Call Logs
docs.text:
To ensure traceability of third-party systems calling the platform's APIs, it's important to record the logs of customer-written API calls. These logs are useful for troubleshooting and analyzing issues.

  1. Users can access the API Logs interface to view call records related to the token created above. The image shows the basic display of the API Logs.

  2. Users can filter API Logs by Date, API Call Status, Token Name, and Request Method, and perform a fuzzy search by API Access Path (The figure above shows the filter options expanded by clicking the Filter icon.)

  3. Users can view detailed API request and response information by clicking on the Detail link for a specific entry.

docs.title: Token Privilege Assignment
docs.text:
Owner users can follow the steps below to create a new role and assign it to target members for collaborative management:

  1. Navigate to the Roles page.

  2. Click the Add a New Role button to create the new role.

  3. Assign permissions in the API Integrations permission group to the new role.

  4. Click the Apply button to create the new role.

  5. Navigate to the Members page.

  6. Select the user to whom you want to assign the new role;

  7. Click the Modify button;

  8. Select the role you just created from the drop-down box in the Roles field and assign it to the user. The user's roles and permissions will be updated.

docs.title: Create an access token
docs.text:
You can follow the 8 steps listed below to create an access token:

  1. Log in to the Platform and switch to the target interface.

  2. Navigate to the API Integrations / Access Tokens page.

  3. Click the Add button to create a new token.

  4. In the Name field, we recommend naming the token after the third-party application that will be integrated so that logs can be easily queried.

  5. In the Token Expiration section, please select the expiration period your application requires. You have four options to choose from: 180 days, 360 days, 720 days, and Permanent.

  6. Description is optional, you can fill it in according to your needs.

  7. Click the Confirm button.

  8. At this point, the page will display a pop-up window will display the specific information of the Token, you can click the icon shown in the figure to copy the token.

Note:

  • For data security, this token is only displayed when it is created, and you will not be able to view the exact token value on the platform after closing the token pop-up window. Please copy your token and store it securely.

  • Provide the token to the third-party integration system to start the development and invocation of the interface. (Currently, it only supports users passing the token manually). For a list of the available resources and their endpoints, see Available API resources.

docs.title: Token Editing and Modification
docs.text:
After the Token is created, you can adjust the basic status and validity period of the Token to meet the company's business needs, there are four types of operations.

  1. Disable: You can disable a token that is enabled. Once disabled, any applications or scripts using this token will no longer be able to access the Platform API.;

  2. Enable: You can enable a token that is currently disabled. Once enabled, the token can be reused to make API calls to the platform.

  3. Edit: You can modify the token's name, expiration time, and description;

  4. Delete: Once deleted, any applications or scripts using this token will permanently lose access to the Platform API. This action cannot be undone, and all records of calls made with this token will be deleted simultaneously.

docs.title: Release notes
docs.text: GoodCloud platform is committed to providing users with comprehensive and high-quality services. Our team is dedicated to continuously improving and enhancing the user experience to ensure that you have the best possible experience. Thank you for choosing our platform, and we look forward to serving you better in the future.

docs.title: New Features
docs.text: • A new API Integration feature has been added, users can use this feature to call GoodCloud platform interfaces. (Please actively contact us if you would like to try this feature).

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text: • Fixed an occasional pop-up reset problem when users perform an advanced search. It now works correctly.

docs.title: Security Updates
docs.text: • Optimized global rate limiting to improve the security of platform interface calls.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• Added a new platform maintenance page, allowing you to know the maintenance and deployment status of the platform on time.
  • Added a new customizable session duration feature. You can set the session expiration time in the VAR/Organization Settings menu bar to avoid the account exit from the platform during operation.

docs.title: Feature Enhancements
docs.text:
• Optimized the display of the Remote Connect button on the Device Details page. You can use the Access Device Terminal and Access Web Admin Panel buttons to remotely access the device.
  • Improved the design of the Brand Customization feature to meet the needs of multi-regional brand customization.
  • Optimized the login logic of entering the security interface to avoid repeated operations by users.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text: • Fixed the Self-view Bound Device interface export function, the table header and device information can be matched properly now.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: Feature Enhancements
docs.text: • Optimized performance of platform interfaces to improve page loading and response time. We will continue to optimize the responsiveness of the interface in iterative releases to improve your user experience.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text:
• Minor UI, functionality, and stability fixes.
    • Set a new standard for Device status UI display:
      • Online: Green.
      • Offline: Gray.
      • Inactive: Orange.
    • Adjusted the text display of alert messages (including initial capitalization, etc.)
    • Added units for values (RSRP, RSSI, RSRQ, and SINR).
    • The display of the Device Details page has been customized, and we will continue to improve the customizability of the page.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text:
• Fixed the issue where invitation emails were not displayed according to brand customization when calling the third-party API. Invitation emails will now be sent using the correct brand-customized email.
  • Resolved the exception that occurred when configuring device groups.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: New Features
docs.text: • Users can now customize their time zone settings for their accounts. The platform portal will dynamically adjust displayed and set times based on the user's selected time zone.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text: • Minor UI, functionality, and stability fixes.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: Feature Enhancements
docs.text:
• Optimized prompt information when moving devices to the device group.
  • Enhanced platform interface performance to improve page loading and response speed.
  • Improved stability of the Brand Customization feature.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text: • Minor UI, functionality, and stability fixes.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text:
• Fixed the issue with some devices where status shown on GoodCloud platform did not match actual status.
  • Fixed the issue with some devices showing 'Deactivated' status despite being connected to the GoodCloud platform.
  • Minor UI, functionality, and stability fixes.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text:
• Fixed the issue with the Re-activate feature not working properly, ensuring that devices can communicate with the cloud platform successfully.
  • Minor UI, functionality, and stability fixes.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text:
• Fixed a problem where deleting a device from the cloud platform would result in an error message.
  • Minor UI, functionality, and stability fixes.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: Feature Enhancements
docs.text: • VAR-created organizations can now utilize the API Integrations feature, which is primarily designed for cloud-to-cloud integration scenarios.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text: • Fixed the issue where API Logs were not displaying correctly.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text: • Fixed the issue where VAR members were experiencing errors when trying to create organizations. Users can now create sub-organizations successfully by assigning them roles with Organization Management permissions.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: Feature Enhancements
docs.text: • For the cloud integration business scenario, third-party interface calls are now allowed at up to 500 calls per minute to meet customers' increased demand for information interaction.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text: • Fixed the issue where VAR members were experiencing errors when trying to manage organizations.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: New Features
docs.text: • Introducing a new log module in GoodCloud, allowing users to access historical operation records on the platform.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text:
• Rectified the issue where the unit values for signal strength in the cellular module were not displaying on the device details page.
  • Minor UI, functionality, and stability fixes.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text: • Resolved a registration error for users signing up for a cloud platform account via invitation links.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: New Features
docs.text: • Added a feature that allows accounts with shared devices to decide whether to continue sharing control. You can now remove devices from the shared list.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text:
• Improved the display content of certain error codes to make the user prompts more friendly and clear.
  • Minor UI, functionality, and stability fixes.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text:
• Fixed the bug that caused the XE300 device to incorrectly show the historical signal strength module.
  • Minor UI, functionality, and stability fixes.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text:
• Optimized platform services to enhance page responsiveness.
  • Minor UI, functionality, and stability fixes.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: New Features
docs.text: • Expanded the Online Docs with a new API Integrations module.

docs.title: Feature Enhancements
docs.text:
• Optimized the Dashboard, Inventory, and Returning views for VAR users to enhance page load speeds.
  • Improved error messages for third-party integrations to make them clearer and more informative.
  • Removed enable, pause, copy, and delete task buttons. These functions will be updated in version 3.0.0. We appreciate your understanding.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text:
• Refined role and permission rules to reduce the likelihood of unauthorized access errors.
  • Minor UI, functionality, and stability fixes.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• A new tag management feature has been added to the VAR view, allowing users to monitor tag usage and manage tags in batches.
  • Added GooCloud Online Docs, which is currently only available to VAR & ORG users.

docs.title: Feature Enhancements
docs.text:
• Optimized the Ping/Trace function and added a new function entry in the Command action group of the Device List.
  • Dashboard map display optimization.
  • For individual users, we have decided to disable the Setting Template feature, which is only available for VAR/ORG.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text: • Fixed the bug that users would display The device is bound by xxx on 0-0-0 0:0 in the router admin panel. Now you will see the exact device binding time.

docs.title: Security Updates
docs.text: • Optimized permission control of Notification logs in the Organization view to prevent unauthorized situations.

docs.title: Known Issues
docs.text: • Fixed the issue that the actual online/offline status of some devices does not match the status of the devices displayed on the GoodCloud; If the above issue occurs in your device, please actively contact us.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.
